course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Late Imperial China
course.description: A comprehensive survey of Chinese history from the ninth down to the eighteenth century, with emphasis on developments in the economy and society, empire-building, and intellectual pursuits.

reviews.author: DiesalT
reviews.title: Perfect for history enthusiasts
reviews.comment_content:
Topics covered in lectures:

Pre-opium war Qing
Opium war
TaiPing rebellion
Foreign imperialism in China
Self-strengthening movement (briefly)

Topics covered in tutorial:

Foreign Imperialists Invasion of China
Reforms in Qing China
The 1911 Revolution
Warlords

Basically covering the history of Qing dynasty and early republican period. Content should be simple if you've taken Chinese history in DSE or if you've studied some Chinese history before.
reviews.comment_teaching:
A good professor passionate about history. His view towards history is unconventional and I don't agree to some of his views. However, I appreciate his emphasis on the problems and biases of traditional historical narrative.

One thing I don't like about him is his lack of referencing, which is extremely important in the field of history. He would raise many historical evidence in lectures without mentioning where there are from, the credibility of those evidence raised is therefore questionable. We don't even have to cite our historical data in the exam essays, further demonstrating this problem.
reviews.comment_grading:
Tutorial 40% (4 x 10%)
Final exam 60%

Tutorials:
There are 4 tutorial sessions, attendance to each session is mandatory. You are expected to read the required readings beforehand and present your views or arguments in the session. There will also be some suggested discussion question posted by Professor Ho so that you can answer the questions in the session.

To be honest, the amount of required readings in this course is inadequate for a history course in university. I personally would prefer a longer time of discussion as well since each of us only got around 4 mins due to the limited time.

Marks for each sessions:
Attendance 2%
Performance 8%

Final exam: (open book)
We have to complete 2 essay questions (out of 4) in 4 hours. You could answer in either Chinese or English. Answers should be typed into a Microsoft word document and uploaded to canvas within the time limit for this online semester. You can exit the zoom session after the first hour of exam. The questions are largely the same with contents in the lecture, so going to lectures will help you a lot in the final exam.

I personally added my own point of view with some historical evidence found in the optional reading and my own investigation, apart from the points illustrated in lectures. Overall, I wrote around 4500 words in English.

Final grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is small if you only aim for B range, just read the required readings and go to lectures, then you'll be fine.

If you want A range, however, much more effort is needed. Read not only the required readings but also the suggested ones, dig up historical evidences and different viewpoints of history from other books by yourself, and most importantly, analyze historical events critically. As a history enthusiast, I found this course rewarding, but you'll probably suffer a lot if you don't like Chinese history, think twice before enrolling this course.

reviews.author: Aoi
reviews.comment_content: 由安史之亂講到康雍乾盛世，主要著墨喺遼宋金夏時期，大概用咗一半時間，明清略講。會講主要既歷史事件，好似黃袍加身、澶淵之盟，基本上初中有讀過中史都識。多數會講當時社會文化經濟方面既野，有一堂開咗清明上河圖出嚟逐個地方分析，嗰感覺同中學唔同。Instructor講明唔係要大家記啲乜野，而係俾我地體會到當時既社會情況，所以唔洗mark筆記就咁去上聽佢講已經okay。
reviews.comment_teaching: 個instructor係廈門大學嚟既visiting scholar，應該淨係上呢個summer就走。佢講書都算好，唔會話照PowerPoint讀（PowerPoint其實好少野，多數係佢上堂elaborate）。每個鐘會暫停一次俾大家去下洗手間，所以上堂個pace唔會太快。Tuto係播紀錄片或者同學present，lecture實際既時間2個鐘都無。每日去上當聽故仔。
reviews.comment_grading:
30% Attendance
30% Presentation (Essay)
40% Final
佢無俾過任何feedback，但係感覺上你正正常常翻齊學做齊野都唔會爛。每堂最後都會take attendance，所以30%係完全穩攞（當然如果係走堂既朋友就爛到喊啦）。Presentation可以兩個人一組，又可以自己一個做，兩個就講15分鐘，一個就7、8分鐘，要交埋一份essay，即係你既講稿其實，兩個加埋要3,000字，自己一個要1,500字，不過最後都取消咗字數限制。佢會俾個topic大家同埋有reading materials（可睇可唔睇）然後自己就嗰topic分享下自己既睇法，例如李約瑟問題、科舉制度。見到佢喺我地講嗰陣會寫低一啲野，但係我估評分都係睇翻篇essay，所以普通話唔好都唔洗擔心，亦都可以用英文present。考試係open book要寫2,000字，題目又一個禮拜前會話俾大家聽，所以完全有時間準備。
reviews.comment_workload: 要翻足堂take attendance，又要寫下eassay做下present，最後final提前準備一下，聽起上嚟一個月做咁多野好似好大workload，但係實際覺得還好，上得summer證明自己平時無野做啫（笑）。
